intro: Adina asperula, commonly known as roughleaf adina, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and the Americas. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its rough, hairy leaves and small, clustered white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Adina asperula is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
